problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the adjacent angles BCA and DCB are complementary and the angle BAC is vertical to EAF, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 15037.88)
C = (15415.18, 11188.88)
D = (12479.75, 15236.5)
E = (34.23, -12294.6)
F = (-16965.77, -12294.6)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 10))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-19965.77, 20034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-14965.77, 20034.23)

# Draw the cyan triangle (A, B, C)
cyan_triangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C], closed=True, color="cyan", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(cyan_triangle)

# Draw the gray triangle (A, E, F)
gray_triangle = patches.Polygon([A, E, F], closed=True, color="gray", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(gray_triangle)

# Draw the line (C, D)
ax.plot([C[0], D[0]], [C[1], D[1]], color="black", alpha=0.6)

# Draw right-angle marker
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle marker
draw_right_angle(ax, A, E, F)

# Draw angle markers
def draw_angle_marker(ax, center, p1, p2, radius, angle_text, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draws an angle marker and label.'''
    angle1 = np.arctan2(p1[1] - center[1], p1[0] - center[0])
    angle2 = np.arctan2(p2[1] - center[1], p2[0] - center[0])
    
    if angle2 < angle1:
        angle2 += 2 * np.pi

    theta = np.linspace(angle1, angle2, 100)
    x = center[0] + radius * np.cos(theta)
    y = center[1] + radius * np.sin(theta)
    ax.fill(x, y, color=color, alpha=alpha)

    # Add angle text
    mid_angle = (angle1 + angle2) / 2
    text_x = center[0] + (radius + 1) * np.cos(mid_angle)
    text_y = center[1] + (radius + 1) * np.sin(mid_angle)
    ax.text(text_x, text_y, angle_text, fontsize=14, ha="center", va="center")

# Add angle markers
draw_angle_marker(ax, B, A, C, radius=2, angle_text=r"$?$")
draw_angle_marker(ax, C, D, B, radius=2, angle_text=r"$40^circ$")

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((E[0] + F[0]) / 2, (E[1] + F[1]) / 2, "17", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="top")
ax.text((A[0] + E[0]) / 2, (A[1] + E[1]) / 2, "21", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The sum of the degrees of an angle and its complementary angle is 90. The BCA angle has a complementary angle with degree 40 so the degree of the BCA angle is 90 - 40 = 50. The length of the hypotenuse of the AEF triangle is 21 and the length of the side opposite to the EAF angle is 17, so the EAF angle equals $\arcsin(\frac{17}{21}) = \arcsin(0.81) = 54.1$. The angle BAC is vertical to the angle EAF so the degree of the BAC angle = 54.1. The degrees of the BCA and the BAC angles of the ABC triangle are 50 and 54.1, so the degree of the CBA angle $= 180 - 50 - 54.1 = 75.9$. Therefore the final answer is 75.9.
